chapter.title: Quick Start
chapter.para: This "Quick Start" will show how to use the Smooks tools to create/edit the Smooks configuration file for Java2Java data transformation.
This chapter should give the readers a brief understanding of the Smooks dev tools.

section.title: Download Smooks Java-to-Java example
section.para: Visit here to download the "java-to-java" example project.

tip.title: Tip:
tip.para: The example projects is base on Maven, we suggest user to create a new eclipse Java project and copy the example codes and .jar files from the example project paste them to the eclipse Java project.

section.title: Smooks configuration file wizard
section.para: Select the Smooks Java-to-Java example project what you created and right-click, select the menu: "New" -> "Other...", find the "Smooks Configuration File" wizard. Click "Next" button.

figure.title: To select Smooks Configuration File wizard

section.para: First wizard page is file path creation page. Select the "src" to be the file's container, and input "smooks-newconfig.smooks". Click "Next".

figure.title: Choose the configuration file container and type the file's name

section.para: The second wizard page is the transform data type choose page.

tip.title: Note
tip.para: Because the quick start introduce how to create/edit the Java-to-Java Smooks configuration file, so choose "Java" type to be the source/target transform data type please.

section.title: Smooks form editor
section.para: When the wizard was finished, a new Smooks configuration file was created and the Smooks editor will be opened automatically.
We will see the "Smooks Form Editor":

This editor contains several parts:
Notify message display area. If there are any errors when users are editing the file, the error area will display them.
Source data tree. The tree will display the structured of transform source data.
Target data tree. The tree will display the structured of transform target data.
Mapping graphical area. Show the data mapping connection lines.
Source/Target data selection links. Click the link, there will open the "Data Selection Wizard" to help user to choose the source/target data.

section.title: Choose the source/target data
section.para: Click the data selection links to choose the transform data. The "Data Selection Wizard" is opened, and there are two data types on the list: XML and Java.

tip.title: Note
tip.para: There will be more and more data types on the list as the development went on.

section.para: Select the "JavaBean Data Type" and click "Next", you will see a java class selection page:

When you finished the java class selection, click "Finish" , we will see, the structured of the java class was be displayed on the Source data tree. Please do the same operation with the target data link.

figure.title: Display structure of the transform data

section.title: Mapping
section.para: As you see, the source/target data tree display the structure of the java class.
How to mapping it?

First, we should know what is we want to transform:
Bind the "customerName" property of the Order#header to the "customerName" property of LineOrder.
Bind the "customerNumber" property of the Order#header to the "customerId" property of LineOrder.
Bind the "price" property of the OrderItem to the "unitPrice" property of LineItem.
Bind the "productId" property of the OrderItem to the "productCode" property of LineItem.
Bind the "quantity" property of the OrderItem to the "unitQuantity" property of LineItem.
Make sense?

OK, let's select the "customerName" item of the "header" item on the source data tree and start to drag it. When the drag item cross into the Mapping graphical area, we will see a connection line. Drop the item onto the "customerName" of the "LineOrder" on the target data view.
Now there will open a dialog to ask you to connect the root node:

figure.title: A dialog to ask user to connect the root nodes

section.para: Please click "Yes" to connect the root node, if you didn't do that, this dialog will open again when you connect other nodes.

tip.title: Note
tip.para: Please remember that: The root nodes of the source data and target data *MUST* be connected.
This rule is not only for Java-to-Java, same with XML-to-Java too

section.para: Now let's do the same operation with the "customerNumber", that is the what we want to see:
Next, we are going to try to bind the properties of the "OrderItem" to the properties of the "LineItem".
Select the "price" and drag it onto the "unitPrice" of the other side tree viewer. The error message display area will show an error:
How to deal with the error ?
Please click the "Fix it" link, there pop a menu and there are several "resolve methods" on the menu.
Select the first resolve method: 'Connect the "OrderItem" to the "LineItem" ', then the "OrderItem" was connected with the "LineItem".
But the notify message area still show some other errors:
OK,Deal it with the fire error ---- Click "Fix it" link and select the first resolve method. The "orderItems" was connected with the "lineItems".

tip.title: Tip
tip.para: We will find that, if we only connect the property node without to connect the parent node of the property, the "connection error" will happen.
The connection of the "price-to-unitPrice" is the "Binding Connection", but there need a "Instance Creation Connection" ---- the connection of the "OrderItem-to-LineItem".

section.para: After that, connect the quantity to the unitQuantity ; connect the productId to the productCode:
Now, we should save the file.The Smooks tools will generate the correct configuration file contents.
OK, Let run the test class: example.Main (Please make sure that the Smooks engine load the correct configuration file)
Success!
